docs.summary: Pauses a scheduled campaign. Learn more about [market campaign scheduling](https://support.wix.com/en/article/managing-your-scheduled-email-marketing-campaign).

docs.summary:
Publishes/sends a specified campaign.
 If `email_distribution_options` are not supplied, the campaign is only published as a landing page.

params.doc: Subject of an email sent to recipient.

docs.summary: Sends a test email for preview purposes. It is heavily throttled - do not use this for regular campaign sending.

permissions.name: Manage Email Marketing
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and manage email marketing campaigns

params.name: senderDetails
params.doc: New sender details.

docs.summary:
Updates sender details (only provided fields will be updated).
 If `from_email` is changed - a verification code will be sent to new email address.
 If verification is needed, a verification email will be sent to the user, and `verification_needed` will return true.

permissions.name: Manage Email Marketing
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and manage email marketing campaigns

params.name: verificationCode
params.doc: Verification code.

docs.summary: Verifies the sender's email using a verification code sent to the user's email address upon update.
Triggered when a campaign is identified as abusive and rejected without sending emails to recipients.
Triggered when a draft campaign is published.
Triggered when the mailing list is not clean and campaign was terminated (not sent to all recipients).
Triggered when a campaign is successfully distributed to all recipients
Triggered when a new (draft) campaign is created.
Triggered when a campaign is deleted.

An account can be active or in some state of suspension (warned/suspended/banned).
 If a user is in a state of suspension they must visit their email marketing account in the Wix business manager and follow the instructions.

docs.summary: unique

members.name: delivered
members.doc: Number of emails delivered.

members.name: opened
members.doc: Number of emails opened by recipients (if a single recipient opens an email twice, it is counted as one unique open).

members.name: clicked
members.doc: Number of recipients that clicked a link in the email. (if a single recipient clicks a link in an email twice, it is counted as one unique click).

members.name: bounced
members.doc: Number of emails that bounced.

members.name: complained
members.doc: Number of recipients that reported email as spam.

members.name: notSent
members.doc: Number of emails not sent because the campaign was terminated.

members.name: mailsSent
members.doc: Total number of emails sent.

members.name: opened
members.doc: Number of landing page views + emails opened.

members.name: clicked
members.doc: Number of landing page link clicks + email link clicks.

members.doc: ID of the campaign that was created.

docs.summary:
Contains information about what will be displayed as the sender's email and name.
 If public email domains (@gmail.com, @yahoo.com, etc.) are used for sending email campaigns, they will not be displayed in the 'from' header.
 Instead, they will be replaced with @pb0x.ascendbywix.com, and the sender's email will be placed in the 'reply-to' header.
 If the user uses an email from a Wix managed domain to send campaigns, that email will be displayed in the 'from' header.
 If the user uses an email from a custom domain that is not managed by Wix, a line will be inserted that states that the email was sent via ascendbywix.com.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. A key/value object. The keys are the Email predefined variables to be replaced by the values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: variables
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. A key/value object. The keys are the Email predefined variables to be replaced by the values.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ACTIVE - Able to use email marketing normally.
  • WARNED - Must explicitly agree to terms of use to activate account.
  • SUSPENDED - Must fill out compliance questionnaire, unable to use email marketing.
  • BANNED - Able to open a support ticket, unable to use email marketing.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • EMAIL_MARKETING - Regular email marketing campaign.
  • INVITATION - mobile place invitation email
  • AUTOMATION - automation

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • WEB
  • MOBILE

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • LOW_ENGAGEMENT
  • SENDER_DETAILS
  • SPAM_TRAPS
  • OTHER

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ACTIVE - Campaign is active.
  • ARCHIVED - Campaign is archived.
  • DELETED - Campaign is deleted.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • DRAFT - Campaign not yet published.
  • PUBLISHED - Campaign published.
  • TEMPLATE - Campaign is a template.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • NOT_STARTED - Campaign not yet distributed via emails.
  • SCHEDULED - Campaign scheduled for distribution.
  • IN_DETECTION - Campaign is being automatically screened for malicious content.
  • IN_MODERATION - Campaign is being manually reviewed by moderators.
  • SAMPLING - A fraction of recipients is selected as a sample and its performance will be assessed to determine further action.
  • SENDING - Campaign is being distributed to all recipients.
  • REJECTED - Campaign was rejected.
  • TERMINATED - Campaign was terminated after unsuccessful sampling.
  • DISTRIBUTED - Campaign fully distributed to recipients.
  • PAUSED - Scheduled campaign has been paused.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • PLAIN_TEXT
  • HTML
  • LIVE_SITE_LINK
  • BACKOFFICE_LINK
  • MONEY
  • DATETIME

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_STATUS
  • ACTIVE - campaign is active, does not mean that it is being distributed
  • ARCHIVED - campaign is archived
  • DELETED - campaign was deleted by the user

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_VISIBILITY_STATUS
  • DRAFT - campaign is being created, but has not been published yet
  • PUBLISHED - campaign has been published
  • TEMPLATE - campaign is actually a template, a feature which has been deprecated

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_DISTRIBUTION_STATUS
  • NOT_STARTED - distribution has not been started
  • SCHEDULED - distribution has been initiated by the user
  • IN_DETECTION - campaign is being checked for malicious content
  • IN_MODERATION - campaign is in moderation after malicious content was found, this step is skipped if nothing is found moderators have to check the email to keep it going
  • SAMPLING - if the campaign contains many recipients, a sample size of recipients will be selected, the campaign will be distributed to these contacts and afterwards the deliverability rate will be checked in order to determine if the email is spam or not
  • SENDING - email campaign is being sent
  • REJECTED - campaign has been rejected by the checking mechanism
  • TERMINATED - campaign has been terminated
  • DISTRIBUTED - campaign has been fully distributed to the recipients
  • PAUSED - a campaign that was before scheduled is now paused
